::: {{.unit-reading}}
# Reading

## Introduction

Positron is still fairly new and under active development. As such, the available documentation is still a bit sparse, and things might change.
Here are a few pointers that hopefully help you as you learn more about Positron.


## Positron = VS Code (often)

As mentioned multiple times, Positron is built on VS Code (technically Code OSS, which is the source behind VS Code). 
That means that almost always, any tip you find for VS Code will also work in Positron. There might be exceptions, especially as Positron continues to evolve and possibly move further away from VS Code. But it's always a good idea to search for help for VS code if you can't find something for Positron, and try if the VS Code solution works. 


## Command Palette Tricks

Typing a `>` at the start of the command palette filters for settings. Prefixing with `!` searches extension commands. Most commands show their key binding on the right; pressing that shortcut closes the palette and executes the command simultaneously.




## Continuing Your Learning Journey

The Positron documentation team publishes weekly tips on the blog, and advanced webinars are archived on YouTube. Contributing a pull request to the docs is welcomed and is an excellent way to cement your knowledge.


* [Help section on the Positron Website](https://positron.posit.co/troubleshooting.html)
